pull.title: build: don't pass -w when building for Windows
pull.body:
This has been around since the introduction of autotools. However at
this point I'm not sure we'd ever want to suppress all warnings when
performing a build, and given that CXX FLAGS will have been overriden
when cross-compiling for Windows (using depends), this would rarely,
if-ever be used anyways.

From https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Warning-Options.html:
> -w
> 
>     Inhibit all warning messages.

verification.payload:
tree d37e37432bf319e59df2f738527fb88d5760f98f
parent 88d8b4e182bfc75e8496f7046af7aab93307b9d0
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1589110035 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1589110035 +0800

build: don't pass -w when building for Windows

This has been around since the introduction of autotools. However at
this point I'm not sure we'd every want to suppress all warnings when
performing a build, and given that CXX FLAGS will have been overriden
when cross-compiling for Windows (using depends), this would rarely,
if-ever be used anyways.

From https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Warning-Options.html:
-w

    Inhibit all warning messages.

events.message:
build: don't pass -w when building for Windows

This has been around since the introduction of autotools. However at
this point I'm not sure we'd every want to suppress all warnings when
performing a build, and given that CXX FLAGS will have been overriden
when cross-compiling for Windows (using depends), this would rarely,
if-ever be used anyways.

From https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Warning-Options.html:
-w

    Inhibit all warning messages.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #15704 (Move Win32 defines to configure.ac to ensure they are globally defined by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: Move Win32 defines to configure.ac to ensure they are globally defined
issue.body:
#9245 no longer needs this, since the main `_WIN32_WINNT` got bumped by something else.

So rather than just lose it, might as well get it merged in independently.

I'm not aware of any practical effects, but it seems safer to use the same API versions everywhere.

issue.title: build: Set minimum required Windows version to Windows 7
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#14922
- bitcoin/bitcoin#17756
- bitcoin/bitcoin#17740
- bitcoin/bitcoin#18003
- bitcoin/bitcoin#18928
- bitcoin/bitcoin#18956
- bitcoin/bitcoin#19375
- bitcoin/bitcoin#15704

Also adds `libbcrypt` to the list of linked libraries, as Boost starts
depending on `BCryptGenRandom` (as will `getrandom 0.2` once we pull the
latest Rust crates in).

issue.title: build, util: Prevent execution for Windows versions less than Windows 7
issue.body:
Windows operating systems older than Windows 7 have been out of support for several years and will not be supported by Gridcoin from this release forwards.

See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14922, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18956, https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/3d5d7aad269c7afe7e36677d3e76c6579e1b8aba

issue.title: build: Tweak NSIS Windows installer
issue.body:
This tweaks the NSIS Windows installer to enable Unicode and also fill in the copyright information. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18059
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21333
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18928
